headline: Morning Headlines: Cuyahoga drops to lowest COVID case rate in Ohio; Incumbent Gov. DeWine leads the field in fundraising
author: Amanda Rabinowitz
sentences:
DeWine leads the field in fundraising
Cleveland partners with NBA to set 60% vaccination goal
Key Ohio Dems ask party to stay neutral in governor primary
Explosion at granite firm leaves man dead, 2 women injured
Democrat making Ohio auditor bid says he'll fight corruption
Cuyahoga drops to lowest COVID case rate in Ohio
(WKSU) -- In just one month, Cuyahoga County has gone from the most COVID-19 cases per capita in the state to the fewest.

Cleveland partners with NBA to set 60% vaccination goal
(Ideastream Public Media) -- Cleveland aims to raise its coronavirus vaccination rate to 60% by the end of the year, and the city is looking to the National Basketball Association for help.

Key Ohio Dems ask party to stay neutral in governor primary
(AP) — Some high-profile Ohio Democrats are urging party leaders to remain neutral in the competitive gubernatorial primary between former mayors Nan Whaley and John Cranley.

Fire officials say two employees at Korkan Granite in Tallmadge apparently were trying to thaw a door to gain access to a large storage container across from the firm’s main building when the container blew up.

DeWine leads the field in fundraising
(Statehouse News Bureau) – The latest campaign finance reports show where Ohio candidates for governor stand ahead of the upcoming May primary.

Explosion at granite firm leaves man dead, 2 women injured
(AP) — Authorities say an explosion at a Summit County granite business has left one man dead and two women injured.
It’s not clear what the employees were using to thaw the door or what caused the explosion, which authorities say sent large amounts of debris flying as far as 100 feet.
Scioto County currently leads the state with more than 3,700 cases per 100,000 residents, as the omicron wave continues to hammer the southern part of the state.
On January 1, the county was averaging 13 times the CDC rate of high transmission, now state health data show the county at about four times the CDC rate.
As part of Cleveland’s hosting of the NBA All-Star Game this month, the league will support pop-up vaccine clinics and a vaccination education campaign.

Democrat making Ohio auditor bid says he'll fight corruption
(AP) — A city auditor from southeast Ohio is announcing his bid to run for state auditor.
Sappington’s experience has been mostly in local politics, serving four years on Nelsonville’s council and the past two years as the city’s auditor.
The push comes as Democrats work to pick someone best capable of leading its ticket to 2022 wins against an all-Republican slate of incumbents.
The NBA will give schools and community groups masks and tests and is giving $100,000 to the Cleveland Foundation’s COVID-19 relief fund.
A former national party chair, ex-state party chairs, and a former Supreme Court justice say neutrality gives selection power to voters.
Democrat Taylor Sappington figures to be the party’s nominee to take on Republican state Auditor Keith Faber in the November election.

Here are your morning headlines for Tuesday, February 1:
Cuyahoga drops to lowest COVID case rate in Ohio
Incumbent Gov.
Ohio Democrats have struggled to attract high-profile candidates to fill out their statewide slate this year.
On the Republican side, incumbent Mike DeWine raised $3.3 million and has more than $9 million in the bank.
Ohio Democratic Party Executive Committee screeners are set to decide their recommendation Tuesday.
Jim Renacci has around $4 million, but that includes a nearly $5 million loan he made to himself.
On the Democratic side, Nan Whaley raised $1.2 million and has nearly $1.8 million cash on hand.
Cranley supporters believe the panel is poised to back Whaley, who is Sen. Sherrod Brown's pick.
John Cranley is just behind, raising just over a million but holding $1.9 million in cash.
The CDC defines a high rate of transmission as 100 cases per 100,000 residents.
Hospitalizations are also down 63% in Northeast Ohio in the last week.
Joe Blystone raised more than twice that, but only has $214,000 cash.
He’s promising to root out corruption in Columbus.
Cleveland’s COVID-19 vaccination rate is 46%.
Names have not yet been released.
And he raised around $150,000.
Incumbent Gov.
